result.execSummary:
The defendant Delafette Marquise Joiner was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Carry Concealed Weapon, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 941.23(2).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: No reply from defendant or surety.
Defendant's Bail Forfeiture Notice returned undeliverable.
Notice of bond forfeiture mailed to defendant; Original in file. ($500.00) gj

Defendant Delafette Marquise Joiner in court with attorney Jessica Bellows.  Thomas L. Potter appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk:  vk    Defendant plead GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to his plea, advised of his Constitutional rights and the maximum penalty.   Defendant advised that if not a United States Citizen, deportation is possible.  Court found that defendant knowingly, voluntarily and intelligently waived his rights.  Guilty Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights, jury instructions and Addendum received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea.  Court found defendant guilty and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record.
Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant. 
The Court sentenced the defendant to serve  30 days at the House of Corrections with 0 days credit with Huber for schoolto commence 1/4/2016.  This sentence is CONSECUTIVE with 15CF4399 and CONSECUTIVE to any other sentence.

Court ordered the defendant pay all of the following;
All court costs to be taken from bail on deposit and and any amounts due and owing subject to payment conditions imposed on 15CF4399.

Filed:  
Sentencing Referral Form

Defendant Delafette Marquise Joiner not in court.  Joanne L Hardtke appeared for the State of Wisconsin. CMC. Cases were to be heard in branch 19 via last entry. Case to be transferred to branch 19 for next court date. This clerk contacted branch 19. Case adjourned to branch 19 for a Plea Hearing.  Plea hearing scheduled for December 9, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Delafette Marquise Joiner in court with attorney Jessica Bellows.  Alex T. Mueller appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk cmt.
Statements by defense counsel that defendant has a pending case set for scheduling in Branch 19. Court will allow this case to be transferred to Branch 19 if Judge Cimpl is willing to accept jurisdiction.  Case adjourned for status conference to Branch 19.  Status conference scheduled for October 28, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant Delafette Marquise Joiner in court with attorney Jessica Bellows.  Kelly O'Neill appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for October 12, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Defendant Delafette Marquise Joiner in court with attorney Jessica Bellows.  Alex T. Mueller appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Status conference scheduled for September 30, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Delafette Marquise Joiner in court with attorney Jessica Bellows.  Sarah McNutt appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Case heard off the record. Defense counsel requests case adjourned for status conference. Neither party requests to address the court on the record. Signed, Filed & Distributed, Agreed Upon Request for A New Court Date form. Case adjourned to branch 23.  Status conference scheduled for September 15, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Delafette Marquise Joiner in court, attorney Jessica Bellows previously in court.  Sarah McNutt appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant appeared LATE. Court admonished defendant for late appearance. Case adjourned for Status Conference to branch 23.  Status conference scheduled for August 20, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Delafette Marquise Joiner in court.  Sarah McNutt appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Case set for Pretrial Conference. Defendant is SPD eligible for counsel appointment. Case adjourned for Status of Counsel date in branch 23.  Status conference scheduled for August 19, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Court ordered no possession or use of dangerous weapons or firearms.
Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.
Court ordered arrest warrant withdrawn.  Recall issued.

Defendant Delafette Marquise Joiner in court.  Alyssa M. Schaller appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant is advised that this case is assigned to Reserve Judge, Branch 45.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant received a copy of the complaint and was advised of right to counsel and maximum penalties.  Court entered a plea of not guilty on behalf of the Defendant.  Court reserves Defendant's right to file a substitution of judge pursuant to Sec. 971.20 until Defendant's next scheduled court appearance. 
Defendant was given a referral to the Public Defender's Office. Defendant MAY be Public Defender eligible. The case is adjourned for a Pretrial Conference in Br. 45.
As of August 1, 2015 case be reassigned to Branch 23, Judge Grady.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for August 6, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Cash bond ordered to be forfeited in the amount of 500.00.
COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT REMANDED TO THE COMMISSIONER ON RETURN OF THE BENCH  WARRANT.

Defendant Delafette Marquise Joiner not in court.  Alyssa M. Schaller appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant failing to appear, Court ordered an Arrest Warrant to be issued.  Court ordered any bail posted to be forfeited.  State's motion for Judgment of Bond Forfeiture 30 days after notification from the Clerk of Circuit Court's Office is granted by the Court.  Court makes finding that there is no possible victim identified, therefore, recompense is not an issue.
Defendant is Out-of-Custody. Court appearance in Out-Of-Custody Court, Room 221 Safety Building on 7/8/15 @ 1:30pm
